metadata.titel_preek: The Line between Good and Evil

locutie.beschrijving: A theological and historical exploration of human depravity, the universality of sin, and the necessity of divine justification. It uses Lincoln, Havel, and Paul to argue that evil is internal, not external.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High. The preacher correctly identifies the 'solidarity in Adam' and the radical nature of 'justification' (dikaiosyne) as more than mere forgiveness.

illocutie.beschrijving: Primarily asserting the reality of sin and the nature of God's judgment, with a late shift toward promising the power of the blood of the Lamb.
voorbeelden: The line between good and evil runs through each person.
Human solidarity in bondage to the power of sin is one of the most important of all concepts.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To strip the hearer of self-righteousness and denial, leading to a state of 'laying down arms' (repentance).
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Implicit. The preacher speaks of the 'power of the Word' but does not explicitly invoke the Spirit's current work in the room.

voorbeelden: Lincoln wrestled long and hard with theological questions.
The web of our life is of a mingled yarn.
Put on the whole armor of God.
But listen: we are not disarmed in order to be disempowered.
I am quite serious about that.
It is hard to imagine any President doing that today.
The promise of God to sinners today is that it will be reckoned to us.
He has... bearing it away from us.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Strong but delayed. The promises are concentrated in the final three paragraphs.

declaratieven.autoriteit: Moderate. The preacher identifies the Gospel but stops short of 'I declare to you' or 'I absolve you'.

indicatoren: Sociological observations of media and companies.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer becomes an observer of history and theology rather than a participant in a divine encounter until the very end.

missende_elementen: Immediate address of the promise to the 'you' in the pew earlier in the text.
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: Delayed relief; the 'event' of the sermon only occurs in the final minutes.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: Theologically rich but framed as a description of a promise rather than the act of promising.
voorbeelden: The promise of God to sinners today is that 'it will be reckoned to us...'

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Personal anecdotes and homiletical 'we' to establish solidarity in sin.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct address used mostly to challenge denial or call for attention.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Limited. Used more for 'You will remember' than 'You are forgiven'.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Dominant. Discussing Lincoln, Paul, 'the girls', 'the man', and 'the powers'.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a lecture-like atmosphere for the first two-thirds.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: Theological truths about sin and the human condition.

actueel_present.gebruik: The 'invasion' of the Gospel in the 'now' of the sermon.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: It follows a long Assertive (Sin) -> Assertive (Justification) -> Commissive (Promise) sequence.
voorbeelden: The God who justified Abraham... is the God who justifies sinners... The promise is that it will be reckoned to us.
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: Theologically sound but rhetorically heavy on the 'talking about' phase.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: Fallen man is... a rebel who must lay down his arms. It is the Lord Jesus Christ who disarms us.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon is a masterful theological essay that eventually lands in a powerful evangelical promise, but it spends a surplus of time in the constative mode of historical/literary illustration.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: Justification means... all who have suffered as a result of our faults will have perfect restitution.
sterke_punten.effect: Provides a robust foundation for faith.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The first 5 paragraphs are almost entirely historical/political commentary.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It becomes an event in the final third, but the first two-thirds are 'talking about' the human condition.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The definition of justification as 'setting right' has high sacramental potential.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: God is described as the one who spoke, but the preacher speaks mostly as an analyst of the text.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Implicitly, through the use of 'This is the gospel'.
tekstueel_bewijs: It is the power of the Word of God which spoke, and it was so.

pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Yes, by focusing on the 'power' that sustains the Christian.
tekstueel_bewijs: This power is able to do things that we can only dream about.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Yes, in the final paragraphs where the Word 'disarms' the rebel.
tekstueel_bewijs: There has been an invasion from on high. The landing troops have arrived.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Shift from 'is/was' to 'gives/promises/declares' earlier in the sermon.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: The God who reckoned Abraham righteous is the God who justifies sinners.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: The God who reckoned Abraham righteous is here now to justify you.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Moves from a general truth to a present-tense event.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The promise is framed as a quote from Romans 4 rather than a direct address.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Use the first person of the mandate.
voorbeeldzinnen: On behalf of Christ, I promise you: your past is justified.

adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Connect the anecdotes immediately to the 'you' of the congregation.
voorbeeldzinnen: The line that ran through Havel runs through your heart this morning.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The balance is actually good; the indicatives are strong.
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Keep the indicatives but make them illocutionarily performative.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A deeply profound sermon that respects the hearer's intelligence. By turning the 'theological information' into 'theological invocation' earlier, the sacramental power would be even greater.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SAT reveals that the preacher isn't just 'sending a message' about sin, but attempting to 'disarm' the hearer (a Declarative act), which SvT's psychological model cannot categorize.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: While rhetorically elegant with its use of Lincoln, the SAT analysis shows the sermon's true power is in the Commissive 'reckoning' of righteousness, not the historical examples.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT identifies that the 'Constative Surplus' in the historical section risks turning the pulpit into a lectern, even if the content is orthodox.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: The line between good and evil runs through each person.
It is the Lord Jesus Christ who disarms us.
kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: Very high; this is the 'event' moment.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic example of 'Theological Homiletics' where the locution is so rich it almost overshadows the illocutionary intent.
